sn22.135:4.3: “Reverend Koṭṭhita, they speak of this thing called ‘ignorance’.
sn22.135:4.5: And how is an ignorant person defined?”
sn22.135:5.1: “Reverend, it’s when an uneducated ordinary person doesn’t understand form, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.
sn22.135:5.5: consciousness, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.
sn22.135:5.7: And this is how an ignorant person is defined.”
sn22.135:6.1: When he said this, Venerable Sāriputta said to him:
sn22.135:6.2: “Reverend Koṭṭhita, they speak of this thing called ‘knowledge’.
sn22.135:6.4: And how is an knowledgeable person defined?”
sn22.135:7.1: “Reverend, it’s when an educated noble disciple understands form, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.
sn22.135:7.5: consciousness, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.
sn22.135:7.7: And this is how an knowledgeable person is defined.”
